lead_paragraph: The body of Giulio Regeni, a doctoral candidate who was doing research, was found on the edge of Cairo with signs of torture methods frequently associated with the security forces.

byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Gaia Pianigiani from Rome.

headline.print_headline: An Italian’s Brutal Death in Egypt Chills Relations
headline.main: An Italian’s Brutal Death in Egypt Chills Relations

snippet: The body of Giulio Regeni, a doctoral candidate who was doing research, was found on the edge of Cairo with signs of torture methods frequently associated with the security forces.
abstract: Body of Italian doctoral candidate Giulio Regeni is found in ditch on outskirts of Cairo, bearing evident signs of torture; death sparks vitriol from Italian officials who believe Egyptian authorities are not only unwilling or unable to find his killers, but that Egyptian security forces may be involved.
